title: Los Angeles County Public Health Department-Madison Hotel

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Los Angeles County Public Health Department-Madison Hotel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide documents for ONLY the years 2017-2018, 2023-2024 inspection and reinspection and complaints for 423 E. 7th Street, Los Angeles 90014 . This includes any violation or notice to the owner, AIDS Healthcare Foundation, that doors needed deadbolts or locks on unit 506 during the following inspection dates/reinspection dates: June 25, 2018, September 12, 2018, October 10, 2018, November 7, 2018.

This request also includes any complaint, inspection, and findings for maggots from dead bodies in the hall, roaches, bedbugs, filth, or mold aka "organic growth."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annette Morasch

communications.subject: FOIA 5498 Muck Rock - Parks FOIA Log
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,



Thank you for your interest in obtaining information from the Chicago Park District. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed.



Your FOIA reference number for tracking purposes is: 5498



You have requested the following records:

“Complete FOIA logs from January 1, 2023 through the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).
At minimum, please include the following:
Date the request was filed
Name of requestor,
status of the request,
Request System assigned identifier such as a Request Number, if applicable

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Chicago Park District (the “Park District”) responds to all public records requests by the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  Please note that the Chicago Park District is closed for the holiday on February 12, 2024.  The due date for your request is Wednesday February 14, 2024 by close of business.  If additional time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.



Kind regards,


Karen Choudhury

communications.subject: FOIA 5498 Muck Rock - Parks FOIA Log
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,

We apologize for the delay but we are still working on your request. Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. Under Section 140/3(e), the Park District is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days from the last due date for the following reasons:

(x ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;
( ) the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records;
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it;
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them;
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions;
( ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by subsection (d) of this Section without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body;
( ) there is a need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among 2 or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request.

If this is acceptable to you, please respond in writing to agree to this extension. new due date for your request is Thursday February 29, 2024 by close of business.
Again, we appreciate your continued patience. You are welcome to contact me if you have any questions.
Kind regards,
Karen Choudhury

title: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email correspondence and documents since September 1, 2022 that reference the “Mental Health Program and Services Unit” or “MHPSU” or “Project No. CPPP17C160160000”  at Santa Rita Jail.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: California Public Records Request #23-219
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Lindsay-Poland,

Pursuant to California Government Code Section 7922.535, we write in response to the inquiry that you made to the Alameda County Sheriff's Office under the California Public Records Act, which we received on, September 14, 2023. We note that the requests are limited only to records in our custody and control.
The Alameda County Sheriff's Office is in the process of searching for responsive, non-exempt data regarding your request.  After review, we will have a cost estimate for you (if any), and upon receipt of payment from you (if any), we will produce these materials.  If deemed necessary, we may have to produce on a rolling basis. We estimate the search to be complete within three weeks.

With respect to your requests, ACSO asserts that certain documents requested may be exempt from disclosure pursuant to Government Code Sections 7927.500, 7927.200, 7927.700, 7923.600-7923.625, 7927.705, 7922.000, 7922.540(a) and possibly additional subsections, and Government Code Sections. ACSO also asserts, certain documents; potentially responsive to your requests, may be shielded by the attorney work product doctrine and the attorney client privilege. Further, some documents may contain confidential information that is protected by Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). Additional privileges may apply based on a review of the records.
Best regards,


[cid:image001.png@01D9EBE9.D37B49C0]
Cynthia Wilson | Sheriff's Technician #235
Alameda County Sheriff's Office

Internal Affairs | 3 Park Pl., 3rd Floor, Dublin, CA 94568

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Wilson,

Thank you so much for the documents produced yesterday in response to my Public Records Act request last September for records that reference the “Mental Health Program and Services Unit” or “MHPSU” or “Project No. CPPP17C160160000” at Santa Rita Jail.

This is an administrative appeal to reverse certain redactions in the document production.

The production includes both redacted copies of emails as well as, separately, redacted copies of attachments to those emails. However, the names of attachments are redacted in the emails (with the exception of agency logos), making it impossible to link which attachments that were produced go with which emails. Nor does the redaction of attachment names in emails correspond to the exceptions cited for redaction in your response (Cal. Gov. Code §§7927.500 and 7927.705), which address state law prohibitions and draft documents. In any case, the redaction of attachment names is inconsistent with the disclosure of the attachments themselves. 

Please re-review the emails that were produced and reverse the redaction of attachment names.

Sincerely,
John Lindsay-Poland

This request has been re-reviewed. Attached you will find the emails and attachments separated in folders. It is not the names of the attachments that is being redacted as it is the access to the unredacted attachment. I have no way to redact the attachment while it is inside of the email. In compliance with the California Public Records Act, the documents have been redacted pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code §§7927.500 and 7927.705.

Due to size, the documents will come in several emails.

1st email
Best regards,


[cid:image001.png@01DA6B0B.909F6B30]
Cynthia Wilson | Sheriff's Technician #235

title: Jimmy Buffett

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jimmy Buffett
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into musician James William Buffett (December 25, 1946 – September 1, 2023), popularly known as Jimmy Buffett. His death is widely-known and has been widely reported. President Joseph Biden himself acknowledged Buffett's passing; you may find a copy of the White House's official statement attached. Therefore, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1604754-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Westford Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Westford Police Department)
communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern: 

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, G.L. c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your school district. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act,  school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE).   DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement.  DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”   


I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 

1.	An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a.	Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b.	Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c.	Charge (or charges)
d.	Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e.	Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f.	Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g.	Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h.	Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i.	Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j.	Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k.	Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l.	Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2.	If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide school incident reports on each school-related arrest and referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 

3.	A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school;  and,

4.	Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with G.L. c. 71 § 37P(b).

5.	The cost to the school district of assigning a school resource officer to each school; and, 

6.	The total number of school resource officers and total number of guidance counselors for each school in your district for school years 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and,

7.	The total number and a brief description of 911 calls from schools in your district to local police departments conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022, and, 

8.	A description of the proposed budget for mental, social, or emotional health support personnel for the school district.

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act.  “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”    

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your school district may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty.  Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.
 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. G.L.c. 66, § 6A(d). 

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply.  To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me by phone at (617)-373-5862 or by email at k.stathulis@northeastern.edu. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.
	
Sincerely, 


Katherine Stathulis, Esq.
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: NY Policing Project (Los Angeles Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails with representatives of the New York University Policing Project from 2021 to present. Specifically, I request emails sent to or received from an email address with the domain "@nyu.edu" or  "@policingproject.org" that were sent between 01/01/2021 and 03/05/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Micah Moody

communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-2205: Dear Requester:   We have reviewed your California Public Records Act request.    Please be advised that, pursuant to California Government Code Section 7922.535, we have found that “unusual circumstances” exist with respect to the request due to the need to search for, collect, and review the requested records from other Department entities which are separate from the office processing the request. Therefore, our staff will require the statutory fourteen days extension of time in which to respond. A determination concerning your request will be made as soon as possible.   If you have any questions regarding this correspondence, simply respond to this email.    Respectfully, LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.

communications.subject: Your City of Los Angeles public records request #23-2205 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ Record request #23-2205 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requestor:   We reviewed your request for "Emails with representatives of the New York University Policing Project from 2021 to present…emails sent to or received from an email address with the domain "@nyu.edu" or "@policingproject.org" that were sent between 01/01/2021 and 03/05/2023."   Your request was made under the California Public Records Act (the Act). The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000.   A search was conducted and responsive records have been released to you.   Please note that some of the records contain minimal redactions to protect information that is exempt from disclosure under express provisions of the California Public Records Act, including California Government Code Sections 7922.000, 7923.600, 7927.200, and 7928.300.   If you have any questions, please respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Communications & Booking Records - A. Steele (Division Of Criminal Investigations, Office Of The Attorney General)

communications.subject: South Dakota Open Records Law Request: Communications & Booking Records - A. Steele (Division Of Criminal Investigations, Office Of The Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all booking records and communications (electronic, hard copy, or otherwise), associated attachments, and related files sent to and from any employee, representative, or other officials of your office regarding Abbey Lynn Steele between 11/16/22 and 1/1/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sherrie Hart

communications.subject: SD AG Office Public Records Request from MuckRock Abby Lynn Steele 147386
communications.communication:
PLEASE SEE ATTACHED PDF

STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA
[Created by DPE, Copyright IRIS 2005]


OFFICE OF ATTORNEY GENERAL
                                                                              1302 East Highway 14, Suite 1
                                                                            Pierre, South Dakota 57501-8501
MARTY J. JACKLEY                                                     Phone (605) 773-3215                                        MARK W. BARNETT
ATTORNEY GENERAL                                                       Fax (605) 773-4106                      CHIEF DEPUTY ATTORNEY GENERAL
                                                                                                http://atg.sd.gov



February 29, 2024

ATTN: Sherrie Hart
MuckRock News
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

RE: Forty-Nine Public Records Requests concerning Communications and Investigative Information

Dear MuckRock News:

On behalf of the South Dakota Office of the Attorney General, I am responding to your public records request dated June 12, 2023, and received via fax by this Office the same day.  You seek communications and investigative information in forty-nine different public records requests identified below by the "DEPT MR" number.  Specifically, you seek:

DEPT MR 147352: All video footage, audio recordings, photos, collected between 1/20/23 and 1/31/23, related to Floyd Joseph Slow Bear (DOB: 1/9/67) who was an inmate at Pennington County Jail and died in custody on 1/31/23.

DEPT MR 147355: Any email, sent or received by any employee of your agency between 1/20/23 and 2/2/23, which includes the keywords "Slow Bear."

DEPT MR 147358: Medical records related to the death of Floyd Joseph Slow Bear (DOB 1/9/67), who died in custody at the Pennington County Jail on 1/31/23.

DEPT MR 147364: All video footage, audio recordings, photos, collected between 11/16/22 and 12/2/22, related to Abbey Lynn Steele (DOB: 5/17/02) who was an inmate at Pennington County Jail.

DEPT MR 147367: Any and all booking records and communications (electronic, hard copy, or otherwise), associated attachments, and related files sent to and from any employee, representative, or other officials of your office regarding Floyd Joseph Slow Bear (DOB: 1/9/67).

DEPT MR 147383: Medical records related to the death of Abbey Lynn Steele (DOB: 5/17/02).

DEPT MR 147386: Any and all booking records and communications (electronic, hard copy, or otherwise), associated attachments, and related files sent to and from any employee, representative, or other officials of your office regarding Abbey Lynn Steele between 11/16/22 and 1/1/2023.

DEPT MR 147390: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers that occurred between 1:30PM and 3:00PM on 3/26/22.

DEPT MR 147392: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers that occurred between 1:30PM and 3:00PM on 3/26/22.

DEPT MR 147397: Surveillance footage related to the investigation of the officer involved in a shooting that took place around 12:20PM on 2/3/23 at the Loaf 'N Jug at 1601 Haines Ave., Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of Eric James Wright (DOB: 11/15/82).

DEPT MR 147401: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting which took place around 12:20PM on 2/3/23 at the Loaf 'N Jug at 1601 Haines Ave., Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of Eric James Wright (DOB: 11/15/82).

DEPT MR 147404: Body-camera recordings from the six Rapid City Police Department officers who responded to a suspected burglary-in-progress at 720 James Warren Drive, Rapid City, SD around 1:30PM, on 3/6/22.

DEPT MR 147410: Medical records related to the death of Eric James Wright (DOB: 11/15/82), who was killed by Rapid City Police Department on 2/3/23 while responding to an incident at the Loaf 'N Jug at 1601 Haines Ave., Rapid City, SD.

DEPT MR 147415: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers body-cameras and dashcams, related to the Rapid City Police Department officer involved shooting that occurred at 100 Surfwood Drive (Knollwood Heights apartment complex), Rapid City, SD, around 10:00PM, on 1/18/23, resulting in the death of Ira Julian Wright (DOB: 11/22/88).

DEPT MR 147421: Surveillance footage related to the investigation of the officer involved in a shooting that took place around 10:00PM on 1/18/23 at 100 Surfwood Drive (Knollwood Heights apartment complex), Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of Ira Julian Wright (DOB: 11/22/88).

DEPT MR 147427: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting which took place around 10:00PM on 1/18/23 at 100 Surfwood Drive (Knollwood Heights apartment complex), Rapid City, SD which resulted in the death of Ira Julian Wright (DOB: 11/22/88).

DEPT MR 147433: Medical records related to the death of Ira Julian Wright (DOB: 11/22/88), who was killed by Rapid City Police Department on 1/18/23 at 100 Surfwood Drive Knollwood Heights apartment complex), Rapid City, SD.

DEPT MR 147437: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding Rapid City Police Department use of deadly force which killed Ira Julian Wright (DOB: 11/22/88), on 1/18/23 at 100 Surfwood Drive (Knollwood Heights apartment complex), Rapid City, SD.

DEPT MR 147450: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers body-cameras and dashcams, related to the Rapid City Police Department officer involved shooting that occurred at 330 Philadelphia Street, Rapid City, SD around 5:00AM, on 1/18/22, resulting in the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64).

DEPT MR 147452: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers body-cameras and dashcams, related to the Rapid City Police Department officer involved shooting that occurred at 330 Philadelphia street, Rapid City, SD around 5:00AM, on 1/18/22, resulting in the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64).

DEPT MR 147467: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding RCPD use of deadly force while responding to a suspected burglary-in-progress at 720 James warren Drive, Rapid City, SD on 3/6/22, which resulted in the death of Barney Peoples.

DEPT MR 147473: Medical records related to the death of Barney Peoples, who was killed by Rapid City Police Department on 3/6/22 while responding to a burglary-in-progress at 720 James Warren Dr, Rapid City, SD.

DEPT MR 147479: Medical records related to the death of Marvin Moran Jr., who was killed by Rapid City Police Department at 1565 Haines Avenue, around 10:30PM, on 7/26/22.

DEPT MR 147485: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting that occurred at 1565 Haines Avenue, around 10:30PM, on 7/26/22, resulting in the death of Marvin Moran Jr.

DEPT MR 147489: Surveillance footage related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting that took place around 5:00AM on 1/18/22 at 330 Philadelphia Street Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64).

DEPT MR 147495: Surveillance footage collected from Chances Casino, and other cameras, during the investigation of the officer involved in a shooting that occurred at 1565 Haines Avenue, around 10:30PM, on 7/26/22, resulting in the death of Marvin Moran Jr.

DEPT MR 147501: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers body-cameras and dash cams, related to the Rapid City Police Department officer involved in a shooting that occurred at 1565 Haines Avenue, Rapid City around 10:30PM, on 7/26/22, resulting in the death of Marvin Moran Jr.

DEPT MR 147504: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting which took place around 5:00AM on 1/18/22 at 330 Philadelphia Street Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64).

DEPT MR 147507: Medical records related to the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64), who was killed by Rapid City Police Department on 1/18/22 at 330 Philadelphia Street, Rapid City, SD.

DEPT MR 147514: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding Rapid City Police Department's use of deadly force that occurred at 1565 Haines Avenue, around 10:30PM, on 7/26/22, resulting in the death of Marvin Moran Jr.

DEPT MR 147518: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding Rapid City Police Department use of deadly force which took place around 5:00AM on 1/18/22 at 330 Philadelphia Street, Rapid City, SD, which resulted in the death of James Mathew Murphy (DOB: 10/11/64).

DEPT MR 147525: Any and all Police camera recordings, such as responding officers body-cameras and dash-cams, related to the Sioux Falls Police Department officer involved in a shooting that occurred around 10:30PM, on 3/31/22, resulting in the death of Cody Wade Kelly.

DEPT MR 147529: Transcripts and radio transmission recordings between officers during the deployment of Rapid City Police Department's/County Special Response Team at Surfwood Drive and E. Knollwood Drive, Rapid City, SD between 1/21/23 and 1/22/23.

DEPT MR 147533: Surveillance footage collected during the investigation of the officer involved in a shooting that occurred around 10:30PM, on 3/31/22, resulting in the death of Cody Wade Kelly.

DEPT MR 147536: All police camera footage recorded during the deployment of Rapid City Police Department's/County Special Response Team at Surfwood Drive and E. Knollwood Drive, Rapid City, SD between 1/21/23 and 1/22/23.

DEPT MR 147541: Any and all 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting that occurred around 10:30PM, on 3/31/22, resulting in the death of Cody Wade Kelly.

DEPT MR 147543: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers' body-cameras and dashcams, related to the Rapid City Police Department's officers responding to a shooting at 20 Surfwood Drive, Rapid City, SD around 11:00PM on 1/21/23, that resulted in the death of Elliot Yellow Hair (DOB: 2/15/1998).

DEPT MR 147545: Surveillance footage collected during the investigation of a shooting which occurred at 20 Surfwood Drive, Rapid City, SD around 11:00PM on 1/21/23, that resulted in the death of Elliot Yellow Hair (DOB: 2/15/1998).

DEPT MR 147549: Medical records related to the death of Cody Wade Kelly, who was killed by a Sioux Falls Police Department officer around 10:30PM, on 3/31/22.

DEPT MR 147551: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, while responding to a shooting incident which occurred at 20 Surfwood Drive, Rapid City, SD around 11:00PM on 1/21/23, that resulted in the death of Elliot Yellow Hair (DOB: 2/15/1998).

DEPT MR 147554: Medical records related to the death of Elliot Yellow Hair (DOB: 2/15/1998), who was shot and killed at 20 Surfwood Drive, Rapid City, SD around 11:00PM on 1/21/23.

DEPT MR 147558: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding Sioux Falls Police Department's use of deadly force that occurred around 10:30PM, on 3/31/22, resulting in the death of Cody Wade Kelly.

DEPT MR 147562: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of a shooting incident which occurred at 20 Surfwood Drive, Rapid City, SD around 11:00PM on 1/21/23, that resulted in the death of Elliot Yellow Hair (DOB: 2/15/1998).

DEPT MR 147566: Police camera recordings, such as responding officers' body-cameras and dashcams, related to the Sioux Falls Police officer involved shooting that occurred at 2507 West 12th Street Sioux Falls, SD, on 8/9/22, resulting in the death of Jacob Michael James (DOB: 12/15/2000).

DEPT MR 147572: Medical records related to the death of Jacob Michael James (DOB: 12/15/2000), who was killed by Sioux Falls Police Department on 8/9/22 at 2507 West 12th Street Sioux Falls, SD.

DEPT MR 147577: Surveillance footage related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting which took place on 8/9/22 at 2507 West 12th Street Sioux Falls, SD, which resulted in the death of Jacob Michael James (DOB: 12/15/2000).

DEPT MR 147582: 911 dispatch audio, transcripts, and radio transmissions between officers, related to the investigation of the officer involved shooting which took place on 8/9/22 at 2507 West 12th Street Sioux Falls, SD, which resulted in the death of Jacob Michael James (DOB: 12/15/2000).

DEPT MR 147587: Any email, sent or received by any employee of your agency between 11/1/22 and 11/20/22, which includes the keyword phrase "Jacob Michael James", "Task Force", or "drug activity".

DEPT MR 147592: Map of crime scene and other media gathered during the investigation of an incident regarding Sioux Falls Police Department use of deadly force which took place on 8/9/22 at 2507 West 12th Street Sioux Falls, SD, which resulted in the death of Jacob Michael James (DOB: 12/15/2000).

Please see the following website for publicly available press releases regarding officer involved shootings: https://atg.sd.gov/OurOffice/Media/Publications/officerinvolvedshootings.aspx#gsc.tab=0.

This Office must decline the remainder of your request.  The type of documents you seek, if they exist and this Office is the custodian of those records, are not subject to disclosure under South Dakota's public records laws.  See SDCL 1-27-1.5(4), 1-27-1.5(5), 1-27-1.5(12), 1-27-1.5(19), 1-27-1.7, and 1-27-1.9.  This includes confidential criminal justice information as defined by law (including criminal investigative information), which is expressly exempt from disclosure.  See SDCL 1-27-1.5(5), 23-5-10, and 23-5-11; Mercer v. S.D. Attorney General Office, 2015 S.D. 31, 864 N.W.2d 299.  Regarding your communications request, documents that may be responsive to your request, if they exist, are not subject to disclosure under South Dakota's public records laws.  See SDCL 1-27-1.5(4), (12), (19); SDCL 1-27-1.7; SDCL 1-27-1.9.  Other exceptions from disclosure may apply.

This Office is only the custodian of records for the South Dakota Office of the Attorney General, which includes the Division of Criminal Investigation.  We do not hold records for other state institutions or political subdivisions, such as the Clerk of Courts, police departments, and jails.  Other state institutions or political subdivisions may possess some records you seek.

Sincerely,
[Text, letter  Description automatically generated]



Jennifer M. Jorgenson
Assistant Attorney General

title: Medical License Application for North Walton Doctors Hospital

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Medical License Application for North Walton Doctors Hospital
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Application and associated documents for the license application for the Hospital that is being located outside DeFuniak Springs, FL called North Walton Doctors Hospital.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

John Passmore

title: SB34 ALPR Data Sharing (Pleasanton Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SB34 ALPR Data Sharing (Pleasanton Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 
We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.
A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.

The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 

A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.

A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)
B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2023.

B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2023.

B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2024 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days. 

B4.  The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2024 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a table (attached) with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records. 

CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 
 
We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at ALPR@eff.org. 
                                          	 
Sincerely,
 
Jennifer Pinsof
Staff Attorney 
Electronic Frontier Foundation

City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request.

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at ALPR@eff.org.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Pinsof
Staff Attorney
Electronic Frontier Foundation

title: SERT TRAC Certificates

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: SERT TRAC Certificates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide information on Florida Emergency Management Agency's Personnel Emergency Management Number: 0070046690 (SERT TRAC) FEMA ID: 0000866833

Please Include individuals name attached to the EM number and approved certificates held by this SERT TRAC EM number (and any record of unapproved certificates). A copy of the certificates is not needed, just a simple description/course number and from which department the said certificates were issued by and in what name they were issued to.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

There should be no fees associated with this request but in the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would fulfill my request and attach an invoice. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment of a written letter.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner

communications.subject: RE: PRR 2024-027 - SERT TRAC
communications.communication:
Hello Mason,

All certs listed have been approved.

Intermediate Incident Command System for Expanding Incidents
IS-3  Radiological Emergency Management
Introduction to the Incident Command System, ICS 100
Public Information in an All-Hazards
Military Resources in Emergency Management
Introduction to the Defense Priorities and Allocations System (DPAS)
Basic Incident Command System for Initial Response
An Introduction to the National Incident Management System
National Response Framework An Introduction
The Homeland Security Geospatial Concept-of-Operations (GeoCONOPS) for Planners and Decision Makers
Leadership &  Influence

Thank you,
Florida Division of Emergency Management

title: Discovered Apps

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Discovered Apps
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The aggregate list of discovered apps on City-owned devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune mobile device management in CSV format. You can find instructions on how to export this list here:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-discovered-apps#monitor-discovered-apps-with-intune

Please select "Export the discovered apps aggregate data set" when asked, rather than "Export the discovered apps raw data set".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C166818-011124
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C166818-011124 received on January 11, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C166818-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=nZGH0ylxadMp5hTpNkeAFviDtVI0tY9qlScAy70AuycP1XwYeBxe2dkmm-2BUNj1MXzLjQ2IPF8mfWPKR-2B8BEPLx678OHY5jwarMrWruV4zjk-3D1cVP_zjBLpfrgXaOp4YsvpsuFscj-2BigQ-2Bp9A9iDYkHaNUwPEWGr-2FNjyk3Yod0AnZ2CU-2FXR-2FjsxyqS1GcS4odwp2Pq9teD2gnDQeZwd74tbmfo4exrDedTFmolEup24PYHvwanGvTbS1S0JBZxaxI9MWC1cyPmyrOVXd8J8xexC-2BNbUxJcwhO9VlCMj92MeoQkZceWAGrfVupEtbc-2BGen-2FnzhCkNFcUAXW7u7XHzGHoRQb0-2Bqy5oCMzws6MEBLIsuyD7O0FAUjwIyXCVtKwcwdv5f5ljj9zd2kblHNnK8TgCftNOM5zpo7VWKfSa-2FdH1JNGQllIJ7xh8oN987N1VkXEtqtTTL6mm9cSBwywo-2BjcbULb31-2FgtoUAicN6EHfjRfx-2BjLW) 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C166818-011124. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C166818-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-discovered-apps#monitor-discovered-apps-with-intune 

Please select "Export the discovered apps aggregate data set" when asked, rather than "Export the discovered apps raw data set". 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-information-technology-795%252Fdiscovered-apps-156867%252F%253Femail%253Ditd_pdr%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdo3aESP6c5l5tdbnrMNB_0Qg%3A1rNqgU%3AtB2ppVHT0_GcIE-UbK05X__r3KQvdM4DBWvx9DSbn_I 
The records being made available to you at this time include the following: The aggregate list of discovered apps on City-owned devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune mobile device management in CSV format 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C166818-011124. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have provided all records responsive to your request. Your request is now closed. 
Sincerely, 
Information Technology Department

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning or concerning these two persons licensed to provide Private Security Services:

Michael N. Pocalyko, DCJS ID: 99-276621; and 
Barbara Pocalyko, DCJS ID: 99-311312.

As well as a business entity licensed to provide Private Security Services:

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with T. McElwee.

title: Crow tribe (Bureau of Indian Affairs)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Crow tribe (Bureau of Indian Affairs)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Memorandums of agreements, contracts and any other kind of formal or informal agreement between the Crow Indian Reservation and the Bureau of Indian Affairs as they relate to the creation of a Crow Tribal Police Force (also possibly known as the Crow Tribe Police Department) under PL 93-638, including a  P.L. 93-638 Contract Proposal to assume all BIA-Office of Justice police protection services for the Crow Indian Reservation submitted by the Crow Tribe in January 2020.

The names and salaries of all police officers belonging or having belonged to the BIA division overseeing law enforcement on the Crow Indian Reservation, starting in 2014. 

The names and salaries of all police officers belonging to the Crow Tribal Police Force for the period of time June-December 2020.

Any document mentioning funding of the Crow Tribal Police Force by the BIA.  

I'm requesting this information for an in-depth magazine story I'm writing for Deseret Magazine.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benoit Morenne

title: Baltimore County detention records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Baltimore County detention records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Detention records for any adults booked, incarcerated, or received at any jail or detention facility in Baltimore County pre-conviction or post-conviction at any point within the following three time periods:

- 10/01/2018-11/15/2018
- 10/01/2020-11/15/2020
- 10/01/2022-11/15/2022

For each record, I specifically request the following data (as available):

- Full name and alias(es)
- Birthdate
- Race/ethnicity (as available)
- Sex
- Booking number
- State or other identification numbers
- Facility (or facilities if multiple)
- Arresting agency
- Received date/time
- Release date/time
- Type of release (eg bail, ROR, etc)
- Last known address
- Initial charge description
- Initial charge statute
- Charging agency
- Final charge statute (if available)
- Court case number(s)
- Bail information
- Custody status (e.g., pretrial, sentenced, etc)
- Any other relevant case/charge information

I recognize that some of these data points may not available for some or all records, so please identify which are not available. Additionally, for those individuals who have multiple custody stints within the three periods, I request records for each custody stint. If any part of this request is unclear or I could provide additional information, please contact me.

The requested records are for academic research purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Stewart, Ph.D.
University of Maryland

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Baltimore County detention records
communications.communication:
12/6/2023


Dear Mr. Stewart,


This is an acknowledgement of your request below, for public information, received by the Department of Corrections, on December 6, 2023. Your request is governed by the Maryland Public Information Act ("PIA"), Maryland Code, General Provisions Article ("GP"), §§ 4-101 et seq.

The Department of Corrections makes every effort to fulfill PIA requests promptly and within the statutory deadline.  However, our response will exceed ten (10) business days.  This is as a result of the scope of request, type and volume of potentially responsive records, nature of search, review and preparation.  You will be contacted with the availability of the records and the possible costs associated with the request as soon as it is available.

If any additional information is needed to process your request, you will be contacted promptly by the Department of Corrections.

Please refer to tracking #23-1125 for any subsequent correspondence pertaining to this matter.


Thank you,

Kelly Shaw
HR Analyst II
Baltimore County Detention Center
720 Bosley Avenue
Towson MD 21204
Phone 410-512-3417
Fax 410-512-3406
kshaw@baltimorecountymd.gov<mailto:kshaw@baltimorecountymd.gov>



Confidentiality Notice:
This e-mail, including any attachment(s), is intended for receipt and use by the intended addressee(s), and may contain legal or other confidential and privileged information. If you are not an intended recipient of this e-mail, you are hereby notified that any unauthorized use or distribution of this e-mail is strictly prohibited, and you are requested to delete this communication and its attachment(s) without further review or making any copies thereof and to contact the sender of this e-mail immediately by reply e-mail.

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #23-1125

title: Brady List (February 2024) (Walla Walla County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (February 2024) (Walla Walla County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your Walla Walla County public records request #24-183 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Walla Walla County ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-183 has been submitted successfully. This letter serves as Walla Walla County’s initial five-day letter, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, to your public records request. After your request is reviewed for content and we determine the department or office in which your request refers to, the County will provide an estimate to provide an initial installment of responsive records. After locating responsive records, the County will determine whether any of the responsive documents are subject to applicable exemptions under the Public Records Act, and to notify any third parties affected by the request. If third party notification is required, twenty (20) business days will be allowed for a response by the third party to those records which specifically pertain to them. As records are reviewed, they may be released on an installment basis. Additionally, the Washington Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and Walla Walla County Resolution 23-201 now allow the County to charge for provision of electronic records. Refer to the hyperlinked documents for the fee schedule for future records installments. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Walla Walla County.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

title: Aliso Creek (Department of Public Health)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Aliso Creek (Department of Public Health)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

News reports state the standing wave at Aliso Creek has caused consternation: https://voiceofoc.org/2023/11/laguna-beach-debates-beachgoers-digging-out-sand-berm-at-aliso-beach/

- Any and all written or electronic communications, including attachments, between your department about Aliso Creek / Aliso Beach "berm." 
- Any emailed or formal complaints about the Aliso Beach Sand Berm breach / standing wave
- Any presentations, memos, environmental assessments or other reports about breaching the Aliso Beach Sand Berm
- Any media of the standing wave, including photos and video

Please limit search across the board to between Jan 1 2023 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: FBI: Kwame Brathwaite

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Kwame Brathwaite
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records mentioning or pertaining to the American photographer and photo-journalist Kwame Brathwaite. Brathwaite was born on January 1st 1938 and died on April 1st of 2023. His death was widely reported in the mainstream media, with coverage of his death by CNN and other media outlets. Brathwaite's brother was a man named Elombe Brath who was active in the 1960s civil rights movement. Brathwaite's photography promoted the "black as beautiful" artistic movement and of particular interest would be any monitoring by the bureau of Brathwaite's work or travels. 

This is a request for any records mentioning, or pertaining to, Kwame Brathwaite, with a special emphasis on any FBI records mentioning Brathwaite and his connections to the Patrice Lumumba Coalition or the Marcus Garvey Coalition or the broader Civil Rights movement. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Kwame Brathwaite. 

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related Brathwaite. 

According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Kwame Brathwaite. Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working on resolving this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I have recently found out that the Maryland Military Department has been closed due mold and asbestos. I am requesting the complete mold and asbestos test results.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M. W.
